reviews.review:
I actually loved it but I think I may need to watch it again to fully understand it. 
It was lovely, interesting and a lot of bits you didn't see coming (but I'm not the quickest! Lots going on though and I'm pretty sure my kids (3 and 5) had absolutely no idea what was going on from start to finish. 

As a mum I cried several times. Lots of referencing to their mother and being that she is dead and they miss her, I cried a lot!! 

Kristoff has a song! Was a bit odd if I'm honest and out of keeping with Disney songs. More like REO speedwagon wrote it in the late 80's era of power love ballads written by rock bands! It was funny though.

It felt more like a musical production than an animation for children and as a musics family, I found it something my own mother wouldn't mind watching. It was very different to Frozen I'd say.

I had to explain a few things to my 5 year old for her to understand it. The way it kept switching from the past to present and the explanation of why things were happening or had happened in the past could easily be lost on little children. Frozen was a lot easier to follow. Girl born with powers, can't control it, hurts her sister, saves her with love - that's it. With Frozen ll there is a heck of a lot more than that to understand.

All my 5 year old took from it was ‘Elsa's mum saved Elsas dad and Elsa nearly drowned but the horse saved her' that's it! 

I'm not sure I like the way Disney is going at the moment. Toy story 4 was a shambles and freaky!! 

If they are going to make films for adults then there should be a divide somewhere. I loved it as an adult who loved the first movie. But not sure it's for little kids which is a shame because they are the fans!
It was ok, sound track is not as catchy with the tunes, a lot of comical moments.
Loved it! It was 10 times better than the 1st movie! So glad it had a new story line and didn’t just play off of the 1st.

Honestly, I was really looking forward to the film, so I was disappointed. It's still enjoyable and the animation is gorgeous, but the plot was a little all over the place and seemed to graze over darker plot points without really doing anything with them. I also had a problem with the lack of a true villain like Hans who I really enjoyed last movie. I still recommend though, as it is not boring and actually quite funny too!

Frozen II is a really good sequel that has grown up with its audience.  There are plenty of songs like the first movie, but maybe not as memorable.  The "Let It Go" song this time is called "Into the Unknown", which is also sung by Elsa (but late in the film).  It won't be as big of a hit fortunately for us parents.  Both my daughters (10 and 6 years old) loved it and prefer this movie over watching the first one.  If you liked the first movie, then you won't be disappointed with this better-late-than-never sequel.

This movie does a great job at keeping up with it's audience who watched the first frozen movie! It ties up and opens more loose ends which makes is possible for even more adventure in the frozen world! This movie is just as good at the first movie with no doubt. If you enjoy the true magic of Disney, get your eyes on this movie quick!
The movie was absolutely amazing!!! I thought it wouldn’t top the first, but it did! Great music, great message!!
But the 1st one was way better.....
Reviewing and exciting a must see for children of all ages
It was a great tie between the first one. Added more depth to the storyline. I want to see it again!!
